header_2: H5N1 in Poultry in South Korea
content_2: Bird flu has been reported at a duck farm in Yesan City, 130 km south of Seoul. Athough highly pathogenic H5N1 had been suspected, low pathogenic avian influenza H5N2 has been identified from samples taken from ducks on the farm.
content_3: Bird flu has been found at a farm in Nghe An province where 300 ducks have died. H5N1 has been detected, according to Department of Animal Health officials. This outbreak follows a recent rash of bird flu cases near Ho Chi Minh City and Nghe An is the third province to be affected since the beginning of September.
content_4: A duck at a farm in Goerlitz near the Polish border in eastern Germany has tested positive for H5N1. The farm has more than 1,000 birds, including turkeys and geese, and the Social Affairs Ministry in the eastern state of Saxony says it has been sealed off. Officials at Germany's national animal healthy laboratory in Riems said the finding was "somewhat surprising" as the country's alert level had been reduced to moderate and none of the neighboring countries have reported any H5N1. Germany had not seen a case of bird flu since December, 2007.
